reference.shortdesc: The syntax note provides additional information within a syntax diagram.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The syntax note explains aspects of the syntax that cannot be expressed in the markup itself.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: The note typically appears at the bottom of the syntax diagram instead of at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The synnote element is specialized from fn. It is defined in the syntax-diagram domain module, which is a specialization of the programming domain module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample show how the synnote element can be used to remind the reader where to find information for a required parameter:
example.codeblock: <syntaxdiagram id="validate"> <title>Validate account setup</title> <groupseq> <kwd>clicmd</kwd> <groupcomp> <oper>--</oper><kwd>user</kwd><sep>=</sep><var>userid</var> <synnote>Your user ID can be found in your account activation email.</synnote> </groupcomp> <groupcomp> <oper>--</oper><kwd>validate</kwd> </groupcomp> </groupseq> </syntaxdiagram>
